virtual void processFrameFromUpperLayer (EtherFrame *frame)
 Override from EtherMAC and EtherMACBase in order to allow 1522 byte Frames (12(macs)+4(vlan)+2(len)+4(FCS) = 22 (mtu:1500)).
virtual void startFrameTransmission ()
 Override to clone packet name to the duplicated frame.

Detailed Description

Currently not used, may be needed thought in the future to allow bigger frames to go through.

void EtherMacVlan::processFrameFromUpperLayer ( EtherFrame *  frame  )  [protected, virtual]

Override from EtherMAC and EtherMACBase in order to allow 1522 byte Frames (12(macs)+4(vlan)+2(len)+4(FCS) = 22 (mtu:1500)).

00048 
00049         // fill in src address if not set

00051             frame->setSrc(address);
00052 
00053         // store frame and possibly begin transmitting
00054         EV << "Packet " << frame << " arrived from higher layers, enqueueing\n";
00055         txQueue.insert(frame);
00056     }
00057     else
00058     {
00059         EV << "PAUSE received from higher layer\n";
00060 
00061         // PAUSE frames enjoy priority -- they're transmitted before all other frames queued up
00062         if (!txQueue.empty())
00063             txQueue.insertBefore(txQueue.front(), frame);  // front() frame is probably being transmitted
00064         else
00065             txQueue.insert(frame);
00066     }

Override to clone packet name to the duplicated frame. 

00082 {
00083     cPacket *origFrame = (cPacket *)txQueue.front();
00084     EV << "Transmitting a copy of frame " << origFrame << endl;
00085     cPacket *frame = origFrame->dup();
00086     frame->setName(origFrame->getName());
00087 
00088     // add preamble and SFD (Starting Frame Delimiter), then send out
00089     frame->addByteLength(PREAMBLE_BYTES+SFD_BYTES);
00090     if (ev.isGUI())  updateConnectionColor(TRANSMITTING_STATE);
00091     send(frame, physOutGate);
00092 
00093     // update burst variables
00094     if (frameBursting)
00095     {
00096         bytesSentInBurst = frame->getByteLength();
00097         framesSentInBurst++;
00098     }
00099 
00100     // check for collisions (there might be an ongoing reception which we don't know about, see below)
00101     if (!duplexMode && receiveState!=RX_IDLE_STATE)
00102     {
00103         // During the IFG period the hardware cannot listen to the channel,
00104         // so it might happen that receptions have begun during the IFG,
00105         // and even collisions might be in progress.
00106         //
00107         // But we don't know of any ongoing transmission so we blindly
00108         // start transmitting, immediately collide and send a jam signal.
00109         //
00110         sendJamSignal();
00111         // numConcurrentTransmissions stays the same: +1 transmission, -1 jam
00112 
00113         if (receiveState==RECEIVING_STATE)
00114         {
00115             delete frameBeingReceived;
00116             frameBeingReceived = NULL;
00117 
00118             numCollisions++;
00119             numCollisionsVector.record(numCollisions);
00120         }
00121         // go to collision state
00122         receiveState = RX_COLLISION_STATE;
00123     }
00124     else
00125     {
00126         // no collision
00127         scheduleEndTxPeriod(frame);
00128 
00129         // only count transmissions in totalSuccessfulRxTxTime if channel is half-duplex
00130         if (!duplexMode)
00131             channelBusySince = simTime();
00132     }
00133 }
